column2: HAWAII DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Hawaii

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column10: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

column2: 2. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column4: red, yellow and green

column2: 3. In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction as you are going:
column4: only if the other driver signals it is safe.
column6: whenever you have the opportunity to do so.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Low ground railroad crossing

column2: 5. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 6. A vehicle using emergency signals is approaching from the opposite direction on a two-lane street. Drivers should:
column4: slow down, move as far to the right as possible and stop.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop.
column8: disregard the emergency vehicle and proceed.

column2: 7. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column4: Steering ability.

column2: 8. When towing a trailer large enough to obstruct your inside rear-view mirror, you are required to:
column4: have an outside rear-view mirror installed on the right side of your vehicle.
column6: have an outside rear-view mirror installed on the driver’s side of your vehicle.
column8: have a person in the vehicle to clear you for right turns.
column10: have outside rear-view mirrors installed on both sides of your vehicle.

column2: 9. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column6: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column8: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column10: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column10: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 11. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 12. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Always rely on
column10: It is not recommended to check

column2: 13. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column4: on the right.

column2: 14. Who's responsible for the mechanical condition of a vehicle?
column4: The Department of Transport.
column8: The driver and registered owner of the vehicle.

column2: 15. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: watch for this species crossing the road.
column6: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column10: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 16. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column4: solid or broken yellow

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: You may make a U-turn.

column2: 19. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column6: Wait for the next green light.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 20. __________________ give you right-of-way to make a left turn.
column4: A green arrow pointing left

column2: 21. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column8: speed up to beat the train.
column10: yield to all trains at the crossing.

column2: 22. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 23. Roads are most slippery:
column4: just before it rains.
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 24. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 25. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 26. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column6: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column8: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column10: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.

column2: 27. Alcohol:
column4: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column6: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column8: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 28. It is illegal to drive below the speed limit:
column4: when the pavement is wet.
column10: when driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 29. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the left.
column8: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing ahead
